intro: Calceolaria linearifolia, commonly known as the slender slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, preferring cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its overall appearance. Calceolaria linearifolia is cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable climates.
